other_tests.changes_over_time: A repeat ECG demonstrated sinus tachycardia with T-wave inversion in lead III.

other_tests.findings: Initially interpreted as normal, except for mild left ventricular hypertrophy and trace pericardial effusion.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A repeat trans-thoracic echocardiogram showed a decreased ejection fraction of 45% and a segmental wall motion abnormality.

other_tests.findings: Revealed normal coronary arteries, severe diffuse hypokinesis, and a markedly reduced left ventricular ejection fraction of 30%.
Elevated at 4.9 ng/ml (initially <0.3 ng/ml upon admission) and peaked at 38.6 ng/ml.
